name: Dark Chocolate Mousse
description: Healthy avocado-based chocolate mousse. Creamy, rich chocolate flavor without refined sugar or dairy.

instructions.instruction: Melt dark chocolate using double boiler: Bring water to simmer in pot, place heat-safe bowl on top, add chocolate and stir until melted.
instructions.tip: No water should touch chocolate - even one drop will ruin it.

instructions.instruction: Remove melted chocolate from heat. Let cool for 5 minutes.
instructions.tip: Too-hot chocolate will 'cook' avocado and change the taste.

instructions.instruction: Cut avocados in half, remove pits. Scoop flesh into food processor.
instructions.tip: Avocados must be completely ripe - firm ones won't blend smooth.

instructions.instruction: Add cocoa powder on top of avocados.
Add maple syrup, almond milk, vanilla extract, and salt.
Process on high for 2-3 minutes. Scrape sides with spatula.
instructions.tip: Process until completely smooth and creamy - be patient.

instructions.instruction: Taste and add more maple syrup if needed.
Divide mousse among serving cups or ramekins.
Cover with plastic wrap directly touching surface - prevents skin forming.
instructions.tip: If wrap doesn't touch surface, a crust will form on top.

instructions.instruction: Refrigerate at least 2 hours, ideally 4 hours.
Before serving, remove from fridge. Garnish with berries and mint.
instructions.tip: Let sit at room temperature 10 minutes before serving - texture softens.

tips: Avocado taste is completely masked by chocolate - you won't notice it!
Avocado provides healthy fats and fiber - guilt-free dessert.
Chocolate quality matters - use at least 70% cacao.
Don't tell guests it has avocado - they'll never guess!
storageInfo: Refrigerate covered for 3 days. Freezing not recommended.
servingSuggestion: Serve in small espresso cups or elegant glass cups. Top with coconut cream, berries, or strawberries.
variations: Peanut butter: Add 2 tbsp peanut butter.
Espresso: Add 1 tsp espresso powder for mocha flavor.
